title: Homeless woman raped after man offers her a room and lures her into back yard
text:
Get the biggest daily news stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

A vulnerable homeless woman was raped twice by a man who lured her into a back yard after offering her a place to stay for the night.

Married dad-of-two Emil Mustata, 31, struck up a conversation with the woman and asked if she was a prostitute after finding her on the doorstep of a hostel.

The rapist, from Romania, pretended to take pity on the woman, who was not a sex worker, and offered her a room, but he took her to a back yard near his home in Scunthorpe, North Lincolnshire, and attacked her.

As Mustata was jailed for nine years, the traumatised woman told how she doesn't feel safe and is no longer "the same person I was before", GrimsbyLive reports.

The woman was temporarily homeless when she was attacked by Mustata, who had been living in the UK for about eight years on and off and was sending money home to his family in Romania.

(Image: Scunthorpe Live)

She had been drinking when Mustata began talking to her and lured her into the yard.

A neighbour heard her screams and called the police.

After the attack, he threw her coat and shoes after her.

The traumatised woman said: "The incident has affected so much of my life. It's something that I really don't want to have to remember. I will never forget it.

"I don't feel safe. I have not been out by myself. I can't bring myself to do it.

Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now

"I feel anxious about any noises I hear. It will live with me for ever. I know that.

"I am not the same person I was before. I am much more sensitive to things and cry for the smallest things.

"I hate how things make me feel now."

Mustata, 31, denied two rape offences but was convicted by a jury after a trial at Grimsby Crown Court.

Andrew Bailey, mitigating, said the woman was vulnerable from drinking and the scene of the rapes was "far from pleasant".

Mustata was jailed for nine years, must register as a sex offender for life and was given an indefinite restraining order.

Recorder Patrick Palmer said: "It's plain that this offence had a significant effect on her. She couldn't go out on her own.

"That's serious offences with serious consequences."

In 2015, Mustata was jailed for eight months in Spain for theft with violence.
description: Married dad Emil Mustata, from Romania, asked the woman if she was a prostitute and pretended to take pity on her before he raped her near his home in Scunthorpe, North Lincolnshire
